) The federal government levies excise taxes to ﬁnance general government tivities and speciﬁc programs. Excise taxes are assessed on the sale, use, inventory of various types of goods, services, or activities. The taxes may imposed at the time of the sale by the manufacturer, the sale by the use by the consumer. All or a portion of the amounts paid are deposited in of the following trust funds: • Highway Trust Fund • Airport and Airway Trust Fund • Black Lung Disability Trust Fund • Leaking Underground Storage Tank Trust Fund • Sport Fish Restoration and Boating Trust Fund • Vaccine Injury Compensation Trust Fund • Inland Waterways Trust Fund • Oil Spill Liability Trust Fund • Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Trust Fund (
) Since there are numerous legislative changes to excise tax law and proce- dures throughout the tax year, the procedures in this IRM correlate with the excise tax forms and publications. (

) It is every IRS employee’s responsibility to protect the statute of limitations. statute of limitation is a time period established by law to review, analyze, resolve taxpayer and IRS-related issues. Employees must always check the statute of limitation before adjusting a taxpayer’s tax account. In general, period of limitation is three years from the due date of the return, the date return was actually ﬁled, or two years from the date of payment, whichever later. If tax is assessed on an account where the period has expired, the justment will go unpostable. Decreasing the tax on an account where the period has expired causes an erroneous abatement. Tax increases within days of the Assessment Statute Expiration Date (ASED) are statute and must be expedited to the Statute Function. The Excise Statute will provided local routing instructions for statute imminent cases. Note: A tax decrease does not go unpostable on an account where the period expired. You must use extreme caution when decreasing the tax on account where the statute has expired. (
) A tax increase cannot be assessed after the period has expired. However, if IRS No. (also known as abstract number) was not previously reported on

, Quarterly Federal Excise Tax Return, the period does not start to run that unreported IRS No. until a return is ﬁled reporting that IRS No. The manual assessment process must be used anytime the Form
